qas.question: With whom did Valencia side in the War of Spanish Succession?
When did English cavalry enter Valencia?
Who led the English cavalry into Valencia?

answers.text: Charles Mordaunt, 3rd Earl of Peterborough, 1st Earl of Monmouth

qas.question: What did Mordaunt capture on his way from Barcelona?

context: The decline of the city reached its nadir with the <a0_0>War of Spanish Succession<a0_0/> (1702–1709) that marked the end of the political and legal independence of the Kingdom of Valencia. During the War of the Spanish Succession, Valencia sided with <a1_0>Charles of Austria<a1_0/>. On <a2_0>24 January 1706<a2_0/>, <a3_0>Charles Mordaunt, 3rd Earl of Peterborough, 1st Earl of Monmouth<a3_0/>, led a handful of English cavalrymen into the city after riding south from Barcelona, capturing the nearby <a4_0>fortress at Sagunt<a4_0/>, and bluffing the Spanish Bourbon army into withdrawal.
